name: Salvia
description: Salvia is a genus of about 1000 species of annual or perennial herbs and shrubs, distributed throughout the world from Central and South America to Central Asia and Mediterranean Europe. It is the largest genus of plants in the family Lamiaceae.Salvia, commonly known as Sage, has slender, tubular-shaped and nectar-rich flowers and often aromatic leaves. It is perfect for beds, borders and containers and is great for bringing butterflies and hummingbirds to your garden.
meaning: The genus name is derived from the Latin word “salvere”, which means “health”, “to heal” or “to feel well and healthy”, as the plant is known for its healing properties. The common name “Sage” is derived from the Old French word “sage” meaning “wise” or “a wise person”.
color_description: Salvia blooms in a range of colors, from traditional dark blue to light blue, red, pink, and white.
